stanza.line: That thou art blamed shall not be thy defect
For slander mark was ever yet thefair
The ornament of beauty is suspect
A crow that flies in heaven sweetestair
So thou be good slander doth but approve
Thy worth the greater being wooed oftime
For canker vice the sweetest buds doth love
And thou present a pure unstainedprime
Thou hast passed by the ambush of youngdays
Either not assailed or victor beingcharged
Yet this thy praise cannot be so thypraise
If some suspect of ill masked not thyshow
Then thou alone kingdoms of hearts shouldstowe
